meanings.definition: Of or relating to a tube or cylinder.
meanings.sent1: The cannular pipe carried water to the garden.
meanings.sent2: The cannular design of the vase made it easy to hold.
meanings.sent3: The cannular straw was so long, it looked like a magic wand.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was styled in a cannular bun, perfectly round and smooth.
meanings.sent5: The cannular shape of the tunnel made it feel like traveling through a giant straw.

meanings.definition: Shaped like a tube or cylinder.
meanings.sent1: The cannular flashlight fit perfectly in his pocket.
meanings.sent2: The cannular body of the telescope made it easy to aim.
meanings.sent3: The cannular pen rolled off the desk and onto the floor.
meanings.sent4: Her voice echoed in the cannular hallway, sounding distant and eerie.
meanings.sent5: The cannular pattern on the rug resembled a row of colorful tubes.

meanings.sent1: The cannular straw allowed her to sip the drink easily.
meanings.sent2: The cannular tunnel echoed with the sound of footsteps.
meanings.sent3: The cannular tree trunk looked like a giant flute in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The cannular echo in the cave made it seem like a concert hall.
meanings.sent5: The cannular pipe carried hot steam through the factory, hissing softly.
